work.name: VU Amsterdam, Biophotonics and Medical Imaging
work.summary: The project goal was to develop a multiple instance deep learning approach to instantly classify several pediatric brain tumors in weakly labelled higher harmonic generatio microscopy images. \nA secondary project goal was to apply deep learning on human skin tissue to predict stretch information from single second harmonic generation microscopy skin images.\nTo be able to interpret results and to improve model accuracy and transparency is of vital importance in health care. To that end, the project aimed to implement explainable artificial intelligence procedures.

work.name: VU Amsterdam, Physics of Living Systems
work.summary: After my bachelor project, I experimented with passivating microscope slides for use with ice binding proteins (IBPs). This exploratory, experimental study aimed to limit glass-IBP interactions in future studies.
